intro: Echium broteri, commonly known as the desert firecracker, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Echium broteri plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
